direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods enable or disable tracking of specific aspects (errors vs. position) during parsing.
The method isTrackPosition() checks the current state of the trackPosition flag, which is directly related to setTrackPosition().
Both methods involve parsing operations and may need to track position or errors based on the input.
Both methods involve parsing operations and may need to track position or errors based on the input.
Both methods may encounter and handle exceptions related to parsing and tracking.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the TreeBuilder is a prerequisite for setting up the parsing environment, which may involve tracking positions.
Parsing input may need to be invoked after setting the track position to ensure the position is tracked during parsing.
After parsing, errors may need to be checked, which can be related to the position tracking.
